page.title: 16REGULAR COMMISSIONS BOARD
page.content: If you are interested in becoming an Army officer it is quite likely that you will have heard of the Regular Commissions Board. This is located in the grounds of a former country house in Westbury, Leighton House and is there to assess the suitability of applicants to be officers in the Army. The RCB is directly responsible to the Department of Army Recruiting in the Ministry of Defence. Each year about 2000 candidates are tested and roughly 300 visitors (Headmasters,Careers staff from schools and Universties), Overseas Armies representatives, and Senior Army officers attend the boards at Westbury. The lectures last for 3-4 days but most who come learn some- thing about themselves which stands them in good stead whether or not they are suitable for officer training.Male & female candidates do similar tests.
